definition: to wave/to beckon
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: That day at Panjiayuan, three sets of people were waving at me.
sentences.chinese: 那天在潘家园，三个人对我招手。

sentences.english: The children waved to their teacher.
The beautiful lady smiles and waves her hand to the handsome guy.
sentences.chinese: 这位漂亮的女士笑着朝这个英俊的小伙子招了招手。

sentences.english: Evidently we have to hitch a passing car.
sentences.chinese: 看来我们得招手搭便车了。

sentences.english: The gym did its research before opting to chase the nudist euro.
sentences.chinese: 健身房在向天体主义者的欧元招手前，做过调查。

sentences.english: The elected president waved to the cheering crowd.
sentences.chinese: 当选总统朝欢呼的人群招手。

sentences.english: The trees extend their loose sleeves and open wide their hearts warm-ly to greet me.
sentences.chinese: 树木舒展广袖，放开心怀，热情地向我招手致意。

sentences.english: I saw my brother beckoning me immediately I got off the bus.
sentences.chinese: 我一下车就看见弟弟在向我招手。

sentences.english: She beckoned her friends closer with a wave of her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她招了招手，唤她朋友们过来。

sentences.english: She turned around and waved at me.
sentences.chinese: 她转过身，朝我招了招手。

sentences.english: He beckoned me from across the street.
Smaolach, who stood over the pile of shoes, beckoned me.
sentences.chinese: 斯茂拉赫站在一堆鞋子后面朝我招手。

sentences.english: He pointed over to me and I smiled and waved back.
sentences.chinese: 他指着我，我回以微笑与招手。

sentences.english: Raise your hand and a taxi appears in no time.
sentences.chinese: 招一招手，立刻就回有出租车开过来。

definition: to wave (one's hand)
to hint/to indicate (an idea to sb)
to turn one's head/to turn around
to pout/to stick out one's lips
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
quick step
to call out to/to greet/to say hello to/to inform/to take care of/to take care that one does not
to yell
to have a smile on one's face
grinning/smiling
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
to walk over (to)

combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书[liu4 shu1] of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds/to comprehend without being told explicitly/to cotton on/knowing (smile, glance etc)
smiling/with a smile
